doc.previous: Functions differing by only a constant have the same derivative and it can be shown that the antiderivative of a given function is actually a family of functions differing only by a constant Since the derivative of the function y x2 C where C is any constant is y 2x the antiderivative of the latter given by
doc.after: The unspecified constant C present in the indefinite integral or antiderivative is known as the constant of integration
